meanings.definition: To remove material that is considered improper or offensive from a text.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to bowdlerize the story before reading it to the young students.
meanings.sent2: The editor decided to bowdlerize the novel to make it suitable for a younger audience.
meanings.sent3: The librarian had to bowdlerize the book by removing the inappropriate scenes.
meanings.sent4: She carefully bowdlerized the article to ensure it met the publication's guidelines.
meanings.sent5: The director had to bowdlerize the film to avoid a higher age rating.

meanings.definition: To censor or edit a text by removing or changing content deemed inappropriate.
meanings.sent1: The government often bowdlerizes sensitive information before releasing it to the public.
meanings.sent2: The author had to bowdlerize his autobiography to protect the privacy of certain individuals.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he wished he could bowdlerize his embarrassing childhood memories.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to bowdlerize her emotions to fit in with her peers.
meanings.sent5: The journalist had to bowdlerize the interview transcript to comply with editorial guidelines.

meanings.definition: To modify a text by omitting or altering parts that are considered offensive or objectionable.
meanings.sent1: The publisher decided to bowdlerize the classic novel to make it more suitable for modern readers.
meanings.sent2: The film director had to bowdlerize the script to ensure it met the movie's target audience.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly said he would bowdlerize the recipe by removing all the calories.
meanings.sent4: She had to bowdlerize her speech to avoid offending any sensitive listeners.
meanings.sent5: The company had to bowdlerize the advertisement to comply with advertising standards.
